description.narrative: By 2019, school principals and teachers are equipped to provide, in interaction with the community, quality education that enhances the natural environment, knowledge and local positive cultural values, and social cohesion.,which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Environmental Sustainability, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022,children aged 3-15 years, girls and boys, are in a supportive environment and benefit from inclusive quality education that integrates local distinctiveness

mailing-address.narrative: Corniche Nord Immeuble Saadi Quartier Camayenne Conakry P. O. Box 222 - Conakry

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2019, school principals and teachers are equipped to provide, in interaction with the community, quality education that enhances the natural environment, knowledge and local positive cultural values, and social cohesion.

description.narrative: Evidence generated, in particular the competency assessment of children entering primary school and recommendations for the roll-out of the child-centred pedagogy, provided the Government with some levers for improving quality. Support to student involvement and responsibility in school life through the Children's Government as well as the renewal and sensitization of parents' associations paved the way for more interactive learning and relevant teaching that integrates local know-how and value. UNICEF worked to facilitate reading learning opportunities by supporting a pilot on bilingual learning and promoting and providing books, including for the youngest children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
